items.content_html:
“Project Zero: A deep dive into an NSO zero-click iMessage exploit: Remote Code Execution”

From a PDF disguised as a GIF to a Turing-complete micro-architecture based on a lossless image encoding algorithm ‚Äì this is somewhere between impressive and terrifying.
items.content_text:
["Project Zero: A deep dive into an NSO zero-click iMessage exploit: Remote Code Execution"](https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2021/12/a-deep-dive-into-nso-zero-click.html)

From a PDF disguised as a GIF to a Turing-complete micro-architecture based on a lossless image encoding algorithm ‚Äì this is somewhere between impressive and terrifying.

items.content_html:
Sometimes, even 2-trillion company does something right. And, whatever their motives, it’s okay to acknowledge that.
New App Store commissions are great for those who benefit from it, but it won’t - and shouldn’t - be enough to face off the antitrust cases.
items.content_text:
Sometimes, even 2-trillion company does something right. And, whatever their motives, it's okay to acknowledge that.  
[New App Store commissions](https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/11/apple-announces-app-store-small-business-program/) are great for those who benefit from it, but it won't - and shouldn't - be enough to face off the antitrust cases.

items.content_html: Politicians use every horrible attacks to push through with their surveillance fetishes, like the most recent attempt to end end-to-end encryption in Europe. The attacker was of course well known to the police. But hey, never pass on such an opportunity.
items.content_text: Politicians use every horrible attacks to push through with their surveillance fetishes, like the most recent [attempt to end end-to-end encryption in Europe](https://files.orf.at/vietnam2/files/fm4/202045/783284_fh_st12143-re01en20_783284.pdf). The attacker was of course well known to the police. But hey, never pass on such an opportunity.

items.content_html: I get used to reading more again. I am currently reading the Wheel of Time series by Robert Jordan. But with my current pace I probably won’t finish it until the next global pandemic (currently at book 4/12) üìö

items.content_html: Baking and baking and baking and baking (with @Sophia9).
items.content_text: Baking and baking and baking and baking (with [@Sophia9](https://micro.blog/Sophia9)).

items.content_html: In the midst of the flour and yeast crisis my girlfriend and I have roused a passion for baking. Projects for today: a braided yeast bun and our second attempt at sourdough rolls.
items.content_text: In the midst of the flour and yeast crisis my girlfriend and I have roused a passion for baking. Projects for today: a braided yeast bun and our second attempt at sourdough rolls.

items.content_html:
Yeat is scarce, so I made some sourdough pizza tonight.

It did not disappoint.
items.content_text: Yeat is scarce, so I made some sourdough pizza tonight. It did not disappoint.

items.content_html: Looking through the possibilities of ARKit 1.5. I can’t get my hands on a new iPad Pro soon enough!
items.content_text: Looking through the possibilities of ARKit 1.5. I can't get my hands on a new iPad Pro soon enough!

items.content_html: You really notice that a lot of people are at home and don’t have much to do. The local park was packed with runners as well as people walking and laying on the lawn.
items.content_text: You really notice that a lot of people are at home and don't have much to do. The local park was packed with runners as well as people walking and laying on the lawn.

items.content_html: At least it’s still spring.
items.content_text: At least it's still spring.

items.content_html: We had a great day at Burgers Zoo in Arnhem, Netherlands, yesterday. I hope to share some more pictures in the next days.
